website_summaries.verdict: A unique clipless pedal design that gives users choices in their riding.
pros: Eggbeater-style cleat mounts make it easy to clip in from virtually any angle
Larger platform surface stabilizes the riding shoe and allows for clipless pedaling
cons: Pedals require a unique cleat design mostly exclusive to Crank Brothers

customer_reviews.title: Great Pedals!
customer_reviews.text: These pedals are amazing. I replaced one Crank Bros Eggbeaters with these so I could take impromptu bike rides with my kids without digging out biking shoes yet also wear bike shoes when I choose to go off road riding. The clips work superbly and the flat side is perfect for wearing street shoes. I've had other brands of clipless pedals and Crank Bros are by far my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald C. Cottrill

customer_reviews.title: Great pedals, poor cleat hardware
customer_reviews.text: These pedals are great, i really like them. They're affordable, yet have CrankBrothers reliable and service free bearing design. I like the composite body, which is tough. I highly recommend them. However, the cleat hardware that was included with these is garbage. the black alignment washer has holes in it that are the incorrect size, and allow the screw head to protrude through the washer! you can see this from the picture above. the lower washer is one from a different pair of CrankBrother pedals, the upper one with the larger holes is from this pair. Not sure why these are different, but beware if you get a set with these large holes, you'll probably need to replace them.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie A. Seifert

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pedals for any ride
customer_reviews.text: My goodness, I had the DoubleShot 2s on my MTB, and really enjoyed them. When I went to upgrade the Warbird I was going to buy the same. But the 3s were on sale so I said yeah let's do that. These pedals are night and day to anything I have had on the bike before. I am not terribly comfortable with slipping out of the clips on uneven weird ground. But honestly riding nonclipped they don't shift or move at all. I have done 10 mile rides in sandals and felt like I was stuck with magnets. Awesome pedals, I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Jewess

customer_reviews.title: Excellent combo pedals
customer_reviews.text: I was after a combination "clipless" and platform pedal for a new e-bike. I already have - and really like - Crank Brothers pedals on my road and mountain bikes so these seemed to be just what I was after. I've had them now for three - four weeks and they perform exactly as I had hoped. I can ride in sandals, Crocks, sneakers (or dress shoes for that matter) for short hops to the store or post office, but switch to cleated bike shoes for longer rides. I love these pedals!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Platform on one side, eggbeater on the other, great idea!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my Crank Brothers Mallet's on my mountain bike with the Doubleshot's as I am more into escaping than charging now days. As hybrids, they are not as robust as some of the mountain pedals, however, they do feature Crank Brothers simplicity and ruggedness, not to mention cleat compatibility. Both Welgo and Shimano have made single sided pedals for some time, but I much prefer the Crank Brothers design. Have always liked the idea of being able to clip out ahead of time approaching a technical section and the large platform of the Mallet was ok, but not ideal. The Doubleshot is exactly what I have been looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Deerail

customer_reviews.title: Great idea that takes some getting used to
customer_reviews.text: The pedal works well however next time I would opt to upgrade to the double shot 3 to get the adjustable pins. Beside that it does take some getting used too to switch back and forth on the fly out on the trail. It is nice to have the choice of which to ride.
customer_reviews.author: C Walker

customer_reviews.title: Steady
customer_reviews.text: No problems at all. I love the versatility of having the flats on one side so if I’m going down hill I don’t have to be clipped in. On the other side they provide a solid clip for my shoes when I’m pushing up a hill or just trying to keep a steady pace. These are well worth their price and I look forward to using them for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Strong, versatile and simple. Well worth the effort and cost.
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the best pedals that I have purchased. They are easy to clip in and out of and they hold your foot in place for great power transfer. Plus they do a great job of self-clearing mud from the clips. I especially like that I can hop on with regular shoes and go for a ride.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Doubleshot pedals
customer_reviews.text: Love my Crankbros Doubleshots. I swapped between clipped and flat for a few months till I got comfortable unclipping (several spills on trails learning). But once I got my setup right, I really enjoy them. I ride clipped on trails but like being able to ride the flats with my kids around the neighborhood and practicing some skills without having to put my shoes on. DEFINATELY recommend for someone new to riding clipped. Practice unclipping at home in the yard so if you fall it doesn’t hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Calem Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Nice versatility
customer_reviews.text: The clips are tight initially as others have said, but they do loosen and get better over time. Initially, I missed being able to clip on both sides of the pedal, but I've come to really like these for when I'm not wanting to be clipped in ... no more worries about accidentally clipping in while climbing up a steep technical hill on my mountain bike and much easier around town in sneakers.
customer_reviews.author: shrimp

customer_reviews.title: I would buy them again and recommend others give them a go.
customer_reviews.text: Construction is 5/5. Quality is 5/5. I got the pedals because I wanted to wear flip flops or sneakers to get around town on my gravel bike while still allowing me to clip in for more technical single track rides. They do not disappoint. Unlike standard eggbeater or spd style pedals it’s tough to find the sweet spot to click in. Whether in a trail or at an intersection it’s more difficult than I expected to clip in quickly when it’s needed.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: These pedals are great. I enjoy being about to go from clipped ...
customer_reviews.text: These pedals are great. I enjoy being about to go from clipped in for speed to unclipped when the trail gets a little more aggressive. If you are trying to decide between clips and platform pedals the double shots give you the best of both worlds.
customer_reviews.author: pwbuck2

customer_reviews.title: Nah
customer_reviews.text: Very annoying pedal. Not sure what I was thinking. Cool concept but then reality sank in. If you like to ride anything harder than a green run these pedals are not for you. Imagine trying to flip the pedal to the side you want while navigating dicey terrain...........No. The flat side is good for sidewalk riding only.
customer_reviews.author: John M Podhirny

customer_reviews.title: Really easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I read some reviews that said they were super tight, maybe they've changed them but mine were perfect. They are a little heavy so if you're one of those super uptight weirdos that care about every ounce, these aren't for you. They're my first set of clip-in peds and I love the fact that the other side is good for using my tennis shoes. I don't like to use the clip-on when I pull the baby trailer behind me. Overall, super satisfied with these.
customer_reviews.author: Bree C

customer_reviews.title: Great pedals
customer_reviews.text: Hey if your thinking about clip in pedals but also like platform pedals these are for you, easy to walk with the cleats, easy in and out while clipping in and out. I did have a problem with one of the pedals ( I do have several sets on other bikes) and had to get hold of crank brothers let me tell you those people bend over backwards to fix your problems, best pedal company I have ever had to deal with. Get these you will like them
customer_reviews.author: greg bagwell

customer_reviews.title: Hybrids aren’t for me
customer_reviews.text: First of all I love crank brothers and have ridden them for as long as I can remember. I bought these hoping they would be a good hybrid option but I’ve decided that hybrid pedals in general aren’t for me. I found that when I was on trail I found it hard for to find the side that has the clip, especially when you’re in a pinch going up a hill and had to clip out and then back in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Split personality pedal
customer_reviews.text: Got a bike that you want to ride with your bike shoes, but sometimes you just want to wear a pair of sneakers? These are the answer. I love my standard Egg Beater pedals, but they don't work with a regular pair of sneakers. Candy and Mallet pedals are better, but still not very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: Great for stationary bike. Second pair I have purchased. Easy to get on bike and clip with one flat side and one with Crankbrothers clear
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: It’s exactly... what you expect. And perfect for dual use.
customer_reviews.text: I ride to work most weekdays and ride weekends on trails. Yes, they’re a pain in the butt, because they not ALWAYS where you want ‘em. But I still love them, look great and work exactly as you’d expect for a dual use pedal!!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: great versatile pedal
customer_reviews.text: great versatile pedal. I use for mountain (MTB) biking (clipped in) and city riding (platform). If you want to use the platform for MTB, get the Doubleshot 3 model, which has the adjustable pins for additional platrorm traction on trails.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Pottinger

customer_reviews.title: Only one side clips
customer_reviews.text: this pedals only clip from one side and they are hard to clip on at first need to get used to them and it takes time for spling to get lose they dont adjust and some times they get annoying wen you hit the wrong side of the pedal and you cant clip on to the pedal
customer_reviews.author: AD&MA

customer_reviews.title: Nice Pedals.
customer_reviews.text: I already had shoes with the proper cleats, so I am already a Crank Brother's customer. I put these on my street bike so that I can flip the pedals and use regular shoes for the Saturday morning market. These pedals work great either way. I like that I can get started riding on the flat side and then flip the pedal and clip-in once I get going. Nice wide platform for regular shoes also.
customer_reviews.author: GDCFlorida

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: I would stay away from these pedals at all cost if you plan to use for any off pavement use. It is virtually impossible to use because you have to constantly rotate pedals to get it on the right side. Terrible solution for mountain bikes. Feel well made for what it is worth.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Pugh

customer_reviews.title: Best of both worlds!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these pedals. I’m a relatively new mountain biker and as such so are those that I ride with. These pedals have allowed me to continue to ride with them while still work on refining my rides when I’m solo. I use the platforms for riding with friends and I clip in when I want to ride solo. Not compatible with shimano setups from what I hear though I’ve never tried. Heavy duty construction while still being low profil and providing a good platform.
customer_reviews.author: Zach P

customer_reviews.title: Decent pedals for the price
customer_reviews.text: Fit and finish is not as clean as other crank brothers products I have used or as the photos would suggest. I use straps on the flat side when not running clipless and the pedal shape does not lend itself to flipping over easily with a toe to strap in hands free.
customer_reviews.author: SkisTrees

customer_reviews.title: Love it !
customer_reviews.text: Love these pedals! My first pair of clipless pedals and I have no regrets! Easy to install on my bike! I like the option of going clipless or just wearing my normal shoes if I just wanna do a test run after some maintenance! Highly recommend for anyone looking to get into clipless pedals!!
customer_reviews.author: blake schoenbrun

customer_reviews.title: Functions well.
customer_reviews.text: I installed these on my mountain bike. They do a good job providing clip in on one side and flat peddle on the other. I like the variety of cleats that allow various release angles.
customer_reviews.author: redshiftTop Contributor: Welding

customer_reviews.title: Best of both worlds
customer_reviews.text: got these to go with my new fiveten shoes, they work great, they come with spacers so no need to buy extra. The pedals themselves are super beefy and spin extremely well. they aren't hard to clip in and out of. the pins on the flats are nice as well. I backed them out a few turns to give myself some added grip
customer_reviews.author: CristianG

customer_reviews.title: I get a peace of mind with these as I can flip the pedal over if I’m not comfortable in a situation and the grip is great and ...
customer_reviews.text: I just got into Mountain biking and being a beginner I wanted a clip less pedal but was nervous about clipping in and out. I get a peace of mind with these as I can flip the pedal over if I’m not comfortable in a situation and the grip is great and adjustable, too. Clipping in and out took a little getting used to, but I’m enjoying these so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kinlee Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Pedals perform good, but are kind of slippery on the flat ...
customer_reviews.text: Pedals perform good, but are kind of slippery on the flat side. It would be great to be able to adjust the pins as in the Mallet Series
customer_reviews.author: ok

customer_reviews.title: Great pedal, platform size is perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I road a similar pedal from another brand for several years, and when I put these on I immediately appreciated the larger platform for when I ride in normal shoes. The extra platform size provides much better grip than the Shimano equivalent, and clipping in is as easy as any of the other Crank Brothers pedals (I have candies and egg beaters to compare to).
customer_reviews.author: Lance S.

customer_reviews.title: Really like the convenience of the the double sides and the ...
customer_reviews.text: Really like the convenience of the the double sides and the pins are grippy and replaceable. Loses a star for the platform side being a bit narrow compared to a traditional flat.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get out of.
customer_reviews.text: Requires significant effort to lock into place and especially to release. The range of motion is intended to allow more flexibility while riding however when they need to release, they take a great deal of effort. Plan ahead! There is a zero degree release replacement cleat but I can't see how that will help with getting them locked into place. Also the tension in not adjustable. I am switching back to Shimano.
customer_reviews.author: John Antal

customer_reviews.title: perfect for what I do
customer_reviews.text: I raced cross country all through high school and still race enduro. I coach an xc team now. For racing these are not ideal. They will be tricky to find the clipless side when trying to clip in. I put these on my cross country bike now that I'm not racing xc anymore. When playing at home I like to use flats. When I am coaching or shedding the trails I like to use clipless. With these pedals I get the best of both worlds. These pedals are also tough and look really good.
customer_reviews.author: brandon kimbro

customer_reviews.title: too tensioned, unable to clip in
customer_reviews.text: couldn't clip in to these no matter how much force I used, using their special cleats. There was no adjustment of tension, and over two weeks on my bike nothing loosened up. Never had any issue clipping into Shimanos.
customer_reviews.author: Jane of the Jungle

customer_reviews.title: "new" product was clearly used and dirty
customer_reviews.text: It looks like these might still work, but they are clearly used and even still have dirt on them! And half of the hardware is rusty!
customer_reviews.author: Hazel J.

customer_reviews.title: Flat side slips
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept of a pedal that can work with clips or on flats, but these pedals didn't have good grip on the flat side. The pins that are supposed to grip into your shoe soles are plastic and not tall enough, so your shoes slip. I think the more expensive Double Shot 3 has better metal pins that are adjustable and grip better.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Dogwood

customer_reviews.title: Great Choice for Practicing Manual
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for commuting with sneakers and cruising with clipless shoe. Plus practicing Manual. Very easy to clip in and get out after repeating three in and out sequences with clipless shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Great Pedal from Crank Bros
customer_reviews.text: Installed these today and they work great, just as good as my Candy pedals from Crank Bro’s. Had no problems with clipping in & out as I’m used to Crank Bro’s setup. Used Street sneakers for a neighborhood ride and again no issues. The built in nuns are not very big which is fine because if I’m riding trials I’m clipped in.
customer_reviews.author: chris dyer

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, but trying to do too much.
customer_reviews.text: Not exactly the biggest fan. I have a set of CB Candy, which I think works well. These are seemingly more difficult it clip in, and the platform side is just ok for grip. Took them off and back to Raceface Chesters for now.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Baggett

customer_reviews.title: Just the right platform size
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. Platform is large enough to comfortably use my bike for a street ride or neighborhood ride with my young kids and hop on/off with ease. Yet, I can aggressively clip in and go after Trail rides when solo or with a group of skilled riders. Would happily put on other bikes
customer_reviews.author: Tom K.

customer_reviews.title: Stiff
customer_reviews.text: Clips were super stiff when I first purchased these pedals. After having a few rides on them, they have loosened up. But there was a break in period for the springs.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: I love being able to just grab my bike have flip ...
customer_reviews.text: I was a lot nervous getting clipless peddles, I had tried them in the past and was not a fan. I half to say these keep you locked in but a small twist and your free at the same time. I love being able to just grab my bike have flip flops on and hit the local store having the best of both worlds right here.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Wirth

customer_reviews.title: perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I thought they were going to be plasticy since they looked somewhat dull, but its just a mat type finish and very grippy metal pedals. must have for sure
customer_reviews.author: Peter Vasta

customer_reviews.title: Save your money- buy something else
customer_reviews.text: These are terrible and during the first ride the orange color faded of chipped away. They only work with their clip which I can even find. Good looking but terrible once used. Save your money
customer_reviews.author: Janet Ehle Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: A nice Crank Bros Pedal for commuting or a longer pull. Use your day shoes or use clip ins the versatility is pretty nice.
customer_reviews.author: thebarista

customer_reviews.title: Most Excellent Item!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Great packaging, crystal clear instructions, all the parts. Installed and works like a dream. Clips are super smooth working. Could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Nice pedals, very hard to clip in
customer_reviews.text: I’m a newbie to clip-ins but I found this clip style very difficult to consistently clip into. Crossing busy roads was dangerous because I couldn’t accurately clip in, and I ended up buying SPD clip-in pedals instead because of this. If these were offered with SPD style clips I would definitely buy them. The pedals are nice for when you wear regular shoes but the ease of clipping in was my main concern.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Crankbrothers are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install after i got the old pedals off. Like the color and they make it easy to pedal and ride! A liitle pricey!
customer_reviews.author: TEMOOR

customer_reviews.title: Great Commuter Pedals
customer_reviews.text: A great pedal for commuting on. Ride it almost every day, did take some time to "break in" as they were a little stiff to clip in and out of when I first got them. (similar to other reviews so I was expecting this). after a few days riding, clipping in and out they loosened up and work great. Nice that I can hop on with non-clip shoes and ride to a meeting or around the neighborhood.
customer_reviews.author: P. Alan

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful pedals for ride options
customer_reviews.text: Love these pedals. No float and very secure. Highly recommend for commuters, clip in beginners, and people who just want to ride with options. They are heavy so if you want something light then this is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Stock_Supergirl

customer_reviews.title: They do it all
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a high quality pedal that I could use with both my cycling shoes and regular shoes and this pedal does the trick. Crank Brothers makes high quality stuff and I will continue to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, quality pedal
customer_reviews.text: Great pedals and perfect for days I'm out for a clipped in ride or a sneakers day commuting in to work.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice that it has screws and powder coated on the DS3.
customer_reviews.author: Pat S.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pedals!
customer_reviews.text: Nice crankbrothers pedals. Allows using clipless and non clipless shoes. Decent weight. Very good finish!
customer_reviews.author: KC Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Hybrid
customer_reviews.text: Convenient if you don't want to clip in all the time. Clips are a little stiff at first.
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: Nice pedals
customer_reviews.text: Very nice inexpensive Crank Brothers pedal. I used egg eaters for many years and love them, but am mostly riding rail-trails now and wanted the option of not clipping in. These work great either way.
customer_reviews.author: Judith M. Semon

customer_reviews.title: Buy the DoubleShot 1 or 2.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 3's for the steal pins on the flats side but they are still slippery compared to dedicated flats pedals
customer_reviews.author: derek curtis

customer_reviews.title: Great pedals for a commuter
customer_reviews.text: I commute to work on my bike and these work great for letting me ride in both my bike shoes and work shoes.
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: Great starters
customer_reviews.text: These pedals are awesome when clipped in. Not quite as good on the flat side because the grip is poor. Great pedals for those first starting out with clipless.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you know what you are doing.
customer_reviews.text: Pedals are fine; however, using clip in pedals is incredibly dangerous. After years of spin class with clip in pedals/shoes, bought these for my wife’s commuter bike. Crash on the first day resulting in a multiple broken bones.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: You need thes pedals!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding pedals that allow the use of clip in shoes as well as normal street shoes. I love them!!!
customer_reviews.author: FAH924

customer_reviews.title: Crankbros rules
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Clip in or platform pedals. Easy to clip into....or not.
customer_reviews.author: Jed Lavoie

customer_reviews.title: Good pedal for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Straight forward practical pedals, well constructed , easy entry and exit. I use them for Bike traveling, rhe platform side is useful when riding with normal shoes. Did not like that the color finish , peels off very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Flavio l.

customer_reviews.title: hard to unclip
customer_reviews.text: Great, but hard to unclip in my opinion. I am switching to SPDs which has been helpful. Love the color though and very sturdy pedals.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Edmiston

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking
customer_reviews.text: Amazing pedals...... very comfy as they are medium size. Easy to cleat on
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy as Shimano.
customer_reviews.text: I'm told they take a long time to break in, unlike Shimano. Still waiting,.. I do like that they have a larger platform on the flats side and feel solid on either side- not sloppy. They are lighter, also. And of course they look pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Agilebrainz

customer_reviews.title: Have Your Cake And Eat It Too
customer_reviews.text: These pedals are as close to perfect as I'll likely ever see. Clip-in on one side, flat pedal w/ grip studs on the other.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great multi purpose pedal
customer_reviews.text: Another awesome Crank Brothers product! I like them enough to buy a second set. I have them on my Reise & Muller SuperCharger trekking bike. It's only 3.5km to the office and I can wear my work shoes. Or throw on my cycling shoes for a 150km ride around the lake...
customer_reviews.author: Terry Phillips

customer_reviews.title: No more guessing.
customer_reviews.text: Very good pedals. The fact that both sides are hybrid are great because you don’t have to look for the right side each time unlike other hybrid pedals.
customer_reviews.author: D.R.

customer_reviews.title: Great pedal, versatile.
customer_reviews.text: Great pedals, good construction and does a great job on the flat side holding your shoe. I was in the snow the other day and was still able to kick the snow out of my cleat and still clip in. Love the Crank Brothers brand, alway happy with their products. Really nothing I can complain about.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa G

customer_reviews.title: Good combo pedals ?
customer_reviews.text: Easy to get out. The flat sides are very slippery as others have said. I ordered larger grub screws with hopes that it helps. Have no miles on them yet.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great pedals.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect commuter style pedals. Have used these for a month now with both my Pearl Izumi shoes for trail-riding and for quick runs to the store and the work for both. Spindle slowly moves around so you're never forcing it to stay on one side no matter what shoes you are wearing
customer_reviews.author: John A.

customer_reviews.title: Work as described but the clipping in is quite difficult.
customer_reviews.text: Overall great product just wish clipping in was easier both in the alignment and the amount of pressure required to make it snap into place.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan B

customer_reviews.title: Too small to be used in a non clip on side.
customer_reviews.text: They work fine a but are very narrow, they should be regular pedal size. When you use the non clip on side you realize it’s to narrow.
customer_reviews.author: mauro domingos

customer_reviews.title: Nice pedals, but incompatible with standard Shimano clips
customer_reviews.text: Nice pedals, only they are not compatible with standard Shimano clips. Instead of buying these but something else that fits with all your existing shoes and clips, so you can switch from bike to bike with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Foulser

customer_reviews.title: Easy to get in and out of
customer_reviews.text: Easy to get in and out of. Only down side is getting to the clip side of the pedal one you stop and go to start
customer_reviews.author: Morm

customer_reviews.title: Great pedal
customer_reviews.text: My first dual platform/SPD pedal and Spd pedal in general. Great for commuters, I bike everyday, fits well with my bike which is an older road bike, doesn’t look weird. For first clipless pedal I find it easy to clip in and out and platform side is Saturday wide and not slippery
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Best of both worlds
customer_reviews.text: These perils of the best of both worlds clips when you want them flats when you want them can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Master Simmons

customer_reviews.title: No brainer
customer_reviews.text: No brainer. Was looking for pedals to have on my. Ike so I can ride with the kids without the need of shoes and also I could use for competition. Very nice pedals. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Franco

customer_reviews.text: Love these!! They are perfectly weighted so the pedals turn slowly so you can ride w/ or w/o clips. The matte black also looks super tight. Great size too, not too big.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Pedals!
customer_reviews.text: After breaking my leg when my Shimano pedals held my foot tight while I went over the bars, I'm a little paranoid about making sure I can separate from the bike when necessary. These pedals allow me to stay clipped 95% of the time, but unclip, flip the pedal, and have a stable platform for sketchier sections. Works great and no more broken bones!
customer_reviews.author: Darrell R. Styner

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Never had any issues. Standard crank bros quality.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine

customer_reviews.title: Super hard to clip on
customer_reviews.text: Super hard to clip on. For a beginner are the worse. Can not adjust the tension on the spring
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Went on easy
customer_reviews.text: Durable pedals I like being able to choose between clipped and out particularly if I have to start and stop frequently
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Great dual option, but make sure you have the right shoes with lots of contact on the platform side
customer_reviews.text: These pedals are a great option for dual use. I have mountain bike shoes that do not have enough surface contact with the pins, so they don't work well with my spd shoes. I would need to buy new shoes that have more surface contact with the pins on the platform side to really utilize these properly. The clip in side is slightly harder than my normal egg beaters for in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Tillson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love bombing hills with these pedals. Allows me to take my bike out without my mountain bike shoes on and truly just enjoy a stroll without being too aggressive. Dual side is SUPER easy to use and understand
customer_reviews.author: Kirby

customer_reviews.title: tricky pedal but you could manage with time
customer_reviews.text: kind off hard to clip it , needs some lubric at the beginning , not to many video or instructions to install with cleats, rather than that good assembly and quality parts
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Bassa

customer_reviews.title: Easy and reliable
customer_reviews.text: These were very simple to install and I have had no issues after hundreds of miles and many rides.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Chickene

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love these. I have to put in some junk ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these. I have to put in some junk miles before the real riding starts, so having the option to be clipped or not is reassuring.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the perfect solution for my tadpole recumbent bike. I can clip in and and not worry about slipping off and getting tangled up. Also with the flat side of the pedals it is easy to let someone else try my bike.
customer_reviews.author: Jay P. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Missing screw
customer_reviews.text: Missing a long screw but everything seems good. Will update after more thorough use
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan V

customer_reviews.title: Crank Brothers, my first pair but will be getting more, actually I did buy a second.
customer_reviews.text: took a little time to get used to these but now I can ride with street shoes and not feel the clips pushing up through the soles but can clip in when needed
customer_reviews.author: David J. Brock

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Versatile
customer_reviews.text: I put these on my mountain bike. Very simple, low profile, and versatile. Clips & flats in one pedal...I likes!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy R Baker

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed, do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Both pedals started clicking after a month. Apparently, the bearings failed or were not packed properly. Also, like others I had a very difficult time both locking in and disengaging. Do yourself a favor and go with SPD’s.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W. Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Needed a two sided (flat and clip-in) for better versatility. Crank Bros offers great products for good prices
customer_reviews.author: W. Fritz

customer_reviews.title: Great pedals for commuting and doing short trips with the ...
customer_reviews.text: Great pedals for commuting and doing short trips with the kids. Also you can use the cleats when you want to go for a longer ride.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for someone who commutes and mtn bikes on the same bike
customer_reviews.text: Works well with street shoes as well as dedicated mtn bike shoes, makes it highly versatile if you use the same bike for everything
customer_reviews.author: James K. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Nice pedal for the price. The engagement is not as positive as Shimano pedals I’ve used. But I like the look, value and versatility of these pedals
customer_reviews.author: runNride

customer_reviews.title: Soooo goood
customer_reviews.text: I can't even begin to say how much I appreciate these pedals, firm connection and I can just ride with my skate shoes when I go to the skate park
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey james walker

product_meta.title: Crankbrothers Doubleshot Hybrid Bike Pedal - Flat/Clipped-In City Bicycle Pedal, Premium Bearings and Seals
product_meta.description: 50-4467 / Crankbrothers Doubleshot Platform Pedals The Doubleshot platform pedal is an all-new hybrid platform pedal that truly gives you the best of both worlds and lets you ride either flat or clipped in without sacrificing comfort or stability. The new design eliminates the 4-way engagement cage that Crankbrothers is known for, instead substitutes a double-sided engagement that enables you to ride either clipped in with cycling shoes, or utilize the platform pedal with normal street shoes without having the pedal cage pushing into the bottom of your foot. Diamond plate pads and molded pins provide excellent traction on the platform, while the double-sided entry cleat provides customizable float and easy entry. Hybrid pedal half flat / half clip-in Moulded pins and ribs for grip Diamond plate pads for traction 2-sided entry / superior mud shedding Premium bearings & double seal system Includes cleats and hardware
feature_bullets: Built for force- the doubles hot 3 was designed to offer a hybrid pedal that could handle an aggressive riding style while remaining versatile
Hybrid pedal- the half clipless, half clip-in pedal lets you tackle the most diverse riding conditions
Adjustable pins- 8 adjustable pins per pedal keep the power transfer completely Locked in
Double Seal- crank brothers original double Seal system with a double lipped internal Seal and new external Seal for superior contamination protection
2 sided entry-equipped with mud shedding 2 sided entry and diamond plate pads for traction
